   1.

      Open User Accounts by clicking the Start button Picture of the Start button, clicking Control Panel, clicking User Accounts and Family Safety (or clicking User Accounts, if you are connected to a network domain), and then clicking User Accounts.

   2.

      Click Turn User Account Control on or off. Administrator permission required If you are prompted for an administrator password or confirmation, type the password or provide confirmation.

   3.

      Select the Use User Account Control (UAC) to help protect your computer check box to turn on UAC, or clear the check box to turn off UAC, and then click OK.

Ah, never mind. I didn't have the UAC turned off. Duh.

Also, in Windows 7, you can't turn it off just by turning the levels all the way down. To completely disable it:

1. Run Registry Editor (RegEdit) by typing regedit at command prompt or at startmenu->run

2. Locate following registry key:
HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Policies\System

3. Locate the following REG_DWORD value:
EnableLUA

4. Set the value of EnableLUA to 0.

After you type in your Serial Key, you might see something saying type in your upgrade key.  Just type in either the default key that you get from the keygen, or the one tat you changed the first 3 digits 1R8.  I was sceptable when I saw it too, and same thing when it says register later instead of register form another computer.  Just click register later.  Make sure you read the instructions very carefully.  The first patch you use when you have to browse to the the Sony Vegas Pro 10 dir, you only have to browse to that one only.  You don't have to browse to the shared - plugins dir, it already patches them.  Just make sure you read the instruction very carefully. works like a charm, as said, but i'd like to warn win7 users (not sure about other OS) that.. at step "e", you have to right-click "SONY Products Key-gen 2.0.exe" and select "run as admin" for it to successfully finish patching. otherwise it will show an error message instead of the "patched successfully" one. same goes for the audio patch fix in step "f", else it will cry about some of the to-be-modified files being in use, etc. also after entering the first serial that needs the 1st 3 chars to be modified to "1R8", at the next step, when asked for the serial a second time, generate another one, and copy that in, leaving it as it is. otherwise there will only be a "register online" option, and no "register other computer" offered. i only had them above issues. now it works fine. BIG THANX to both MART!K and man-o-tor for it!
